page.title: 17TEST WAY
page.content: The Test Way came into existence on the route of the now- dismantled railway-line which ran from Southampton to Andover and was known as the "Sprat and Winkle" line, and was itself built on the route of the 18c Redbridge to Andover canal. In 1984, H.C.C. designated the length from Stoneymarsh near Michelmersh, to Fullerton near Andover, a public bridle-way. This right of way offers views of outstanding beauty, with the river to the East and the Downs to the West, and an abundance of wild flowers is replacing the gravel of the railway bed. The bridleway forms part of the longer Test Way which travels from Totton in the south to Inkpen, Berkshire in the North.
